title: International Disaster Response Unit Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Abilene, TX) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
My interview process with Samaritan's Purse consisted of three stages.  First, after submitting an online application via Workday, I was contacted to set up an phone screening interview.  The initial phone screening interview was with one representative from HR, lasting around 1 hr.  I was previously an employee with Samaritan's Purse overseas, but as this was applying for a domestic-based position, and there had been a gap in time since my last employment, the phone screening interview centered mostly around a 'ministry fit' set of questions; seeing if my personal beliefs and values aligned with core values of the organization.  

After the phone screening interview I was cleared to proceed to the second step, a video interview via Spark Hire.  This was my first time completing video interviews via a video platform, but it was user friendly.  Interview questions for me were challenging and stimulating, diving deeper than qualifications on paper and connecting to one's character on the job, especially as it relates to problem solving, working in a team, following leadership, etc. 

My video interview responses were reviewed by the hiring manager and I was cleared to move to what would be the final round, a group panel phone interview with my supervisor, the director of my unit and another colleague on the unit.  This lasted one hour and dove deeper into qualifications and previous experience as well as similar questions around my character on the job. 

From point of first contact via email, to the receipt of an offer, the whole process was professional and very positive.  I was not sure of the outcome and regardless felt that I was treated with respect even if I was not to be identified as the top candidate.
Interview Questions: Name an instance where you disagreed with your supervisor?  What did you do?  How did you handle the situation?

title: OCC Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The listing had been posted for 30+ days on indeed.com, I clicked the link and applied online through their website. I received an email 2-3 weeks later asking to do a video interview, it had to be completed within 24 hours. 2 days later I got an email asking to set up a skype interview, which happened 2 days later. They said I would hear back within a week if they wanted me to move on to an in person interview. I heard back 3 days later that they chose someone else, via a phone call. 

Overall, the HR person I communicated with and interviewed with was extremely professional and kind. I love this ministry. The video interview was 4 questions, and I got around 1-3 minutes to see the question before I had to answer and I got about 1-3 minutes to give my answer. The questions were: what would you say to someone who asks you how to be saved; what makes you an ideal candidate for this position; why do you want to work for SP; and what skills do you have as an office administrator (or the role you are applying for))? 

The skype interview centered around you agreeing with SP's statements of faith and personal conduct policies. They ask you more faith based questions like when was a time God clearly called you or purposed you for something. Or about a time you witnessed God's sovereignty in your life.  They did ask more job specific questions and how you would fill the role they are hiring for as well, but I didn't have time to write those down or remember! Since it is a Christian nonprofot, the HR are extremely nice and made me feel at ease the whole time.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have as an office administrator (or the job title you are applying for)

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Charlotte, NC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very professional yet not intimidating at all. Christian values are definitely questioned, but acceptable since this is a ministry. Not everything is made clear during the interview though, like changes in pay periods when going from one part of the project to another.
Interview Questions: How would I describe my walk with God

title: Nutrition Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Boone, NC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Multiple stages, thorough. SP is able to find the best skills because of their questions test out many qualities in a potential candidate. They are multi stage, therefore, able to eliminate those that are less fit
Interview Questions: What makes you think you are able to work in South Sudan?

title: Monitoring and Evaluation Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the position in the DRC. I got an email within a week or two after asking to set up a Skype or phone interview. I did the phone interview, and was told I would be contacted within 1-2 weeks if I was selected to go to the second round of interviewing with the national DRC team. I checked in 2.5 weeks later and they told me there had been a delay in the decision making process. I checked in 2 weeks after that and received no response after that. From what I've heard from SP employees the process can take quite a long time.
Interview Questions: What is your faith story? (How did you become a Christian?) What roll do you see the Holy Spirit playing in your life? What do you think the Christian community's response to abortion should be? What projects have you worked on? Has anyone ever challenged your character, and how did you respond to that? What projects have you worked on where you've had to use analysis skills? How have you responded to bad team members in the past?

title: Seasonal Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Boone, NC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very long process with a lot of personal inquiry not related to the job. Took a long time to communicate decisions. I did not realize  that they only hire individuals  with a conservative right wing Christian agenda. Make sure you agree with everything the CEO says and does before applying. You cannot have any other opinion. Interview process  was a little  extensive for a temporary position.  I wish I read other posts on glassdoor  before applying. That said the interviewers were all very nice and straightforward.
Interview Questions: Tell me your definition of marriage.

title: Human Resources Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Charlotte, NC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly similar to most. It is a Christian organization so they have the ability to ask questions relating to belief. Was given an assessment initially with examples of various scenarios and rate them in order of importance. Answered a variety of general interview questions. Discussed Clifton Strengths Finder results and the top five areas of strengths. Knowing yourself and your God given gifts and abilities is very important to this organization, especially with Operation Christmas Child.
Interview Questions: If I were to ask you what the condition of the interior of your car is like right now, how would you describe it?

title: Social Media Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Boone, NC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview, then an interview panel/visit was scheduled. Before attending the face-to-face, they sent HR paperwork to fill out. They said I would be required to never drink in public again. I wasn't entirely comfortable with that since in my latino heritage  drinking is not demonized like in puritanical faiths. However, since I'm not a big drinker, I agreed. They said I could never have sex with or live with a man before marriage. I was single and that's personal, so I would never talk about that at work anyway, so okay. They also required a signature claiming that I believe God condemns homosexuality and finds it an abomination. I said I do not judge anyone, including people who feel that way, but I would never believe God finds any of his creations an abomination. The HR recruiter claimed it was a requirement for employment, so I canceled the interview and wished them well. I would never work for someone who discriminates against people based on their faith, gender, race, or orientation. If you're a Christian, you should know it's not your place to judge the righteousness of others. She said they wanted everyone to be "of the same mind," but I think differently, and I enjoy and embrace intellectual diversity. I think this would be a good work place for someone who enjoys dogma, routine, and public prayer. There are a lot of rules for not an unfair level of pay, but I have made more money in a position that makes a greater impact on the community. Every year, I used to donate to and volunteer for samaritan's purse. I haven't since and won't ever again.  Better to donate to local churches that you can trust and that do mission work/outreach.
Interview Questions: Will you agree not to drink in public?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Boone, NC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is difficult to get an interview unless you know someone.  However, once you get in the people are very friendly and helpful.  The interview questions were average questions.  Of course, being a Christian ministry there were several questions about belief systems and relationship with Christ
Interview Questions: What is the most meaningful experience you have had ministering out of the country?

title: User Experience Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Upland, IN) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were two portions: faith based and then skill based interviews. Honesty was key here. It seems like they can tell when you are just spouting out responses that they want to hear.
Interview Questions: How did you come to your faith? What are your views on some of the biggest controversial topics of today from a Christian standpoint (It was a little more specific than that, but I'm sure the question will change as time goes on)? What experience have you had in the field? etc.

title: Regional Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Dallas, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very long process and wait for interview. Had one interview via phone, another in person with entire office staff. Interviewer left prior to interview and a substitute filled in via Skype. I was promised a decision within a few weeks; waited several months and never received a response even after several messages left.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you plan to increase volunteer rates among minority demographics?

title: International Regional Manager OCC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Telephone, TX) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: First spoke with someone in HR, then had a telephone interview with regional manager followed by a phone interview with regional director. The starting salary for this position was in the upper 50's and I had been earning $85K. The organization would have paid for my relocation. Ultimately I decided not to pursue the position, but it wasn't because of low salary. After a phone interview with the regional manager and then the regional director, it was evident that the organization would be too rigid and confining for my personality and work style. There would have been very little opportunity for advancement. There would have also been 120 days of travel annually at about 2 weeks for each trip. That was more than I wanted to travel. I think Samaritan's Purse is a wonderful organization it just wouldn't have been a good fit for me.
Interview Questions: Why I was considering the position?

title: Staff Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process can take a long time. You'll have multiple interviews and will have to take an editing test.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Regional Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Boone, NC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by in-person interview. The process was relatively straight forward and easy. Most questions are behavioral in nature; however, there will be few simple technical questions related to the job your applying for. There will also be specific questions about your faith and value system , so be prepared to answer those. I was reimbursed mileage and meals, as well as put up in a hotel (Marriott) for the night. Overall, pleasant interview process.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where a person you were friends with was doing something inappropriate?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse
Interview Descriptions: Long process.  Few only work in HR so it can take awhile before interviews move ahead
Interview Questions: Tell me about your spiritual journey and why you feel called to this position ...

title: Regional Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Samaritan's Purse (Boone, NC) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The process began with an on-line application and submission of a resume. After about 10 days received an e-mail requesting a phone interview within a couple days. They called. A group of about 5 were present with questions from all involved. Went very smoothly. About 10 days later received a telephone call requesting a on site interview. They arranged to meet my limited availabilty schedule and paid all expenses for an across the United States trip. Paid for the two nights in a hotel, meals and a vehicle.

The on site interview lasted for about 6 hours and included lunch with several from the department. The interview process was with both individuals and small groups at various levels and positions in the department. A low pressure and enjoyable process actually.

Learned the result within about 5 days, which was no offer, but they invited me to apply for a different position within the same department. I did not due to other personal circumstances.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would handle receiving simultaneous phone calls from around the world along with immediate demands within the office? (This is an international relief organization. The position is responsible for operations in several countries, but within a world region.)
